instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1465: What is A1465? A1465 is a model number for a 11 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2924, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00164, 820-3208, 820-3435..
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.SMC_LSOC_RST_L: What is SMC_LSOC_RST_L? SMC_LSOC_RST_L is a signal that comes out of the trackpad on Macbook Airs that can reset the SMC.  _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2014 Won't turn on if battery attached.
threads.message:
I have this <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, it works perfectly, battery charges, runs great on battery power, reboots just fine. No signs of liquid and the Mac is in mint condition.

Trouble is when you turn the computer off, it won't turn on again with the power button. When the charger is connected it charges the battery but the macbook doesn't turn on (sometimes if the battery is very low it does turn on). You have to disconnect the battery, plug in the charger, it turns on by itself, connect the battery again and it runs great until you turn it off again.


I've tried another battery, the Mac behaves the same.
I've measured <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> when battery connected and power button pressed: 0.42V.  (If not pressed 3.42V as usual).

I've measured voltage on F7140: 
7.40V battery only
Slowly goes from 7.40 to 8.6V battery + charger connected
8.59V only charger

What i also tried is with the battery disconnected, connect the charger, it turns on, i turn it off from the OS without disconnecting the charger, and it doesn't turn on again with the power button. <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> goes to 0.40V but it doesn't turn on. Tried shorting the pad to ground but same result.

SMC bypass does not work either. 

Can it be a bad SMC? Bad keyboard (is the only i have unfortunatelly)?

Any help is much appreciated. Thanks!

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2014 Won't turn on if battery attached.
threads.message:
Can you turn it on with <RESISTOR>R5115</RESISTOR>/16 pads, if keyboard is disconnected?
Check <SIGNAL>SMC_LSOC_RST_L</SIGNAL> w/ and w/o trackpad flex connected.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2014 Won't turn on if battery attached.
threads.message:
Can you turn it on with <RESISTOR>R5115</RESISTOR>/16 pads, if keyboard is disconnected?

Tried with <RESISTOR>R5116</RESISTOR> and no, it doesn't turn on


Check <SIGNAL>SMC_LSOC_RST_L</SIGNAL> w/ and w/o trackpad flex connected

With flex connected: 1.59V

With flex disconnected: 3.4V



I don't get why it doesn't turn on bridging <RESISTOR>R5116</RESISTOR>. 


I'm gonna try: "What i also tried is with the battery disconnected, connect the charger, it turns on, i turn it off from the OS without disconnecting the charger, and it doesn't turn on again with the power button. <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> goes to 0.40V but it doesn't turn on. Tried shorting the pad to ground but same result." But this time with flex disconnected.


Sorry for the next late response, i have to head out of my house and i'll be back in 8hs.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2014 Won't turn on if battery attached.
threads.message:
"With flex connected: 1.59V"
There is a problem with trackpad board, or flex.

Did you try <RESISTOR>R5115</RESISTOR>/16 pads with trackpad flex disconnected?
Or just removing keyboard from trackpad board?
